issue.title: [chandler] feature: Ability to reorganize contact types
issue.body:
![image](https://github.com/monicahq/monica/assets/57866459/42ea884b-7e4e-414f-baed-09aed7841766)

---

I would like to be able to define which contact types are at the top and which ones are at the bottom.
You are technically already able to do this by deleting everything and recreating them or modifying all of them one by one based on their position in the list but it's clearly not optimal.

I think there should be something like this in the "Manage contact information types" page.

comment.body: I had to run `alter table contacts add column viewed_at timestamp null;` to work around `2017_01_28_222114_remove_viewed_at_from_contacts`. After this, the rest of the migrations applied cleanly and the app works.

issue.title: Broken migration 2017_01_28_222114_remove_viewed_at_from_contacts
issue.body:
## Bug description

I am trying to deploy Monica 4.0.0 into a greenfield installation with an empty database. The initial set of migrations failed, and I get the same output if I trigger manual migrations with `php artisan migrate`. The app is obviously broken because the migrations have not completed.

I am running in Kubernetes with a Helm chart from [gabe565](https://github.com/gabe565/charts/tree/main/charts/monica) but I have overridden the values and I am using the `4.0.0-apache` image, instead of the `4.0.0-fpm-alpine` image.

Looks like it could be related to, but different from #6316 and #6525

## How to reproduce

1. Create `docker-composer.yml` with the following and launch with `docker-compose up`:

```yaml
  monica:
    container_name: monica
    image: ghcr.io/monicahq/monica-next:main
    volumes:
      - ${DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR}/monica/database.sqlite:/var/www/html/storage/database.sqlite
    environment:
      - APP_ENV=production
      - APP_URL=https://my-website.com
      - APP_TRUSTED_PROXIES=*
      - APP_KEY=${MONICA_APP_KEY}
      - DB_DATABASE=/var/www/html/storage/database.sqlite
      - DB_PASSWORD=${MONICA_MYSQL_PASS}
      - MAIL_MAILER=log
      - MEILISEARCH_HOST=monica-meilisearch
      - MEILISEARCH_KEY=${MONICA_MEILI_MASTER_KEY}
    ports:
      - 8080:80
    restart: unless-stopped

  monica-meilisearch:
    container_name: monica-meilisearch
    image: getmeili/meilisearch:latest
    depends_on:
      - monica
    volumes:
      - ${DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR}/monica/meilisearch:/meili_data
    environment:
      - MEILI_MASTER_KEY=${MONICA_MEILI_MASTER_KEY}
    restart: unless-stopped
```

2. Configure and run a queue with `docker exec monica php artisan queue:listen --queue=high,low,default` ([as per tutorial](https://docs.monicahq.com/developers/setup-local-development))

## Environment

- self-hosted instance

#### *Thank you* for your bug report – we love squashing them!
